text: The number of viruses and bacteria on earth is staggering and they occupy essentially every environment. A liter of surface seawater typically contains in excess of ten billion bacteria and 100 billion viruses. The number of viruses on Earth is estimated to be around 10 31 , which corresponds to roughly ten billion times the number of stars in the universe [1] . An average human is made up of about 30 trillion cells but carries a similar number of bacteria, mostly in the gut [2] .
